review: I like this product quite a bit.  My home theater PC broke so I got this on sale for $20 to hold me over until I fixed it.  But I've hardly needed it, because this little guy does quite well on it's own.  The picture quality is great.  It responds pretty quickly and the remote is simple.  You can watch Netflix through this after downloading the Netflix app.  That works pretty well.  What I really like is while binge watching Breaking Bad, it will automatically load the next episode when the previous one ends.  It will start playing about 20 seconds.  Hardly enough time to run to the bathroom.  When you start it up again the next day, it remembers what episode you are on.The only complaints I have are that if I accidentally hit the wrong button, it will take me back to the main menu and then it takes a few seconds to get back to where I was.  Of course, this is my fault for hitting the wrong button.The other thing is mine glitches every now and then.  It's not a bad glitch, just a quick freezing of the picture, enough to miss a single word.  It can be rewound and re-viewed.The rewind is kind of weird.  It sort of shows you a picture of the frame it is on as it travels backward.  This is handy when you are rewinding a long way, because you can see the scene you are looking for.  But it can be hard to rewind just a sentence or two.  Overall, I would call this a first world problem.  They've done a pretty good job with this product especially if you got it for the $20, like I did.
author: ozone

review: I was so excited to receive this  on Christmas eve as it was scheduled to come mid January.  Easy to install, plug in the USB, plug into the electrical socket.  All was well as I was on episode 3 of John Adams, the screen paused, said that the internet connection was slow and to return later.  After several days of upgrading my modem, changing all passwords, I still have not gotten past episode 3........frustrating to try to understand what speeds are necessary to have streaming movies.  Most likely the device is fine, I just need to consult an expert regarding connectivity..........

I initially purchased the Fire Stick, but found it was back ordered - I sure liked that remote idea! In the meantime, I bought a Roku stick. It's nice, however the remote is funky shaped. Otherwise, it's really a good device. Finally, the Fire Stick came in (2 weeks early I might add) and this thing is beyond awesome. Now, I just gotta find someone to take the Chromecast and Roku players off my hands. I know, regift them!

review: Great device for the $19.99 I spent on it. Good alternative to Chromecast for those folks that don't want to deal with using their phones. Only issue I have is with the mini USB placement. If your only open hdmi is between  2 other taken ports you'll either have change your ports around to accommodate the FireStick due to the power cord plugging in from the side instead of the rear like Chromecast does..  or use the included dongle so it hangs away from the other hdmi cables already plugged in.
